answerText: 1,3-dipolar cycloaddition reactions (prompt on "pericyclic reactions")[10] This doubly-eponymous cycloaddition, which won its discoverers the 1950 Nobel Prize in Chemistry, is a 4+2 cycloaddition. It generates a six-membered ring from the reaction of a diene with a dienophile.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Michigan A, MIT A | 14 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name these concerted reactions in which two new sigma bonds are formed and two pi bonds are broken.
